column4: Hi folks.  I recently upgraded my 9.10 system to 10.04.  As always it's been a bit bumpy, but of note is that PHP seems to not be active anymore.  It says it's enabled in the Apache log when I restart apache, but if I visit a PHP page I simply get a download offer back from the web server.  Any idea what could have broken?  I've not seen this sort of problem in years.
if I'm not mistaken, apache changed something during one of the updates which will cause that problem
it's been a while since I had to deal with it
Found it.  Apparently the default configuration for apache2/php5.conf disables PHP for all public_html directories.
No, I don't think so.  The packages are already installed and the DirectoryIndex is being set by an .htaccess file.  AllowOverride is set to All.
if you remove the .htaccess file, does it work?
Nope.  I renamed .htaccess to just htaccess.  No change.  Still works in Konqueror but not Firefox.
Sorry, I have no idea what would cause that...are the headers set correctly? Maybe Firefox is more strict?
is it just the index or any php?
Other PHP files work fine, as does index.php if I access it directly.
The return mimetype is text/html it looks like, according to wget.
how are you accessing index when it doesn't work?
sacarlson: Well I just tried both the HTML and PHP versions.  Firefox still wants to download the file.
